snippet.textDisplay: Well this one is quite obscure. Back in 2014 when this game released, I must have bought this game on Steam solely because I saw it was a Metroidvania which was a rarity back then. If you look at screenshots, you'll see what seems like an indie game you would find on the Xbox Indie store for a buck or 2. I sometimes open up my huge backlog of Steam games and randomly choose a game in there to install and play, and last month I landed on this. I almost stopped after 10 minutes but I'm surprised to say that this is a perfectly competent metroidvania. The humor is very hit & miss, but the gameplay is actually nice with the 3 different characters each having their own set of combat/traversal skills. If you played all the top games in this genre already, I would actually recommend this.
snippet.textOriginal: Well this one is quite obscure. Back in 2014 when this game released, I must have bought this game on Steam solely because I saw it was a Metroidvania which was a rarity back then. If you look at screenshots, you'll see what seems like an indie game you would find on the Xbox Indie store for a buck or 2. I sometimes open up my huge backlog of Steam games and randomly choose a game in there to install and play, and last month I landed on this. I almost stopped after 10 minutes but I'm surprised to say that this is a perfectly competent metroidvania. The humor is very hit & miss, but the gameplay is actually nice with the 3 different characters each having their own set of combat/traversal skills. If you played all the top games in this genre already, I would actually recommend this.

snippet.textDisplay:
The clap stuff really reminds me CDI Zelda games musics. and the compositions itself somewhat reminds me some Amiga tracks.
Nice find! I didn't know this one !

snippet.textDisplay:
Cool, A Shakashuri song.


It's the drumbeat to which our spirits dance. It's only the size of a fist but it packs a lot more punch. Some folks say its every beat is the sound of God kicking an angel in the face. My heart's beating to heal the suffering. I want to spread that beating around to those less fortunate than...

snippet.textDisplay: I started listening to this track, then I was like, "Okay, sounds kinda good," then it just got better and better. Could not stop listening until it ended. Great stuff.
snippet.textOriginal: I started listening to this track, then I was like, "Okay, sounds kinda good," then it just got better and better. Could not stop listening until it ended. Great stuff.

snippet.textDisplay: Hmm, kinda reminds me of VVVVVV's soundtrack. Didn't expect to bob my head to this when I clicked on the video.

snippet.textDisplay: This sounds quite good in an unexpected way!
